processed.result:
You are given an array of $n$ integers. You need to find the minimum number of integers you need to add to the array so that the median of the new array is $x$.  You can add any integer from 1 to $10^5$ to the array, including the same number multiple times. You cannot remove or change any of the original integers in the array. 

The median of an array is the middle element when the array is sorted in non-decreasing order.
You are given a list of numbers and a target number.  You need to figure out the fewest numbers you can add to the list to make the middle number of the sorted list equal to the target number.
